column4: hi, anyone is Oz? I am trying to connect to a Telstra 3G and having problems?
what problems?
thanks: just wont connect; recognizes it, but fails to connect.
does it say anything at all?
like authentication failure or sth.?
no. the network Manager icon spins around and then just stops in a failure graphic: but no error message.
it just tries and then stops and says 'disconnected'.
take a look at /var/log/daemon.log networkmanager writes in there
OK looking .. . .
you may paste it to http://paste.ubuntu.com/ then i will take a look
shall I paste it to you somewhere: please point me to the paste bin?
does this help: taraduffy-laptop NetworkManager[954]: <info> disconnect failed: (32) The serial port is not open.
which version of ubuntu are you running?
might be a bug. did you update all the way?
yes, up to date.
you can try to include maverick-update if you didn't already do that
do you mean just run Update Manager?
sudo software-properties-gtk
gksu software-properties-gtk
are you trying the update?
